intro: Hypocalymma minus, commonly known as the small-flowered hypocalymma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is a perennial shrub that grows low to the ground and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value. Hypocalymma minus is well adapted to dry conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
